DOC.HEAD: Group Crosses Danube By Boat, Four Arrested
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Four men believed to be agents of ousted dictator Nicolae Ceausescu's hated security police agents were arrested Monday in Yugoslavia, Belgrade radio reported. The four were part of a group of Romanian defectors who crossed the Danube into Yugoslavia overnight at Kladovo, about 100 miles east of Belgrade. ``It can be assumed with great certainty that they are members of the Securitate'' _ the secret police, the broadcast said. Several other Romanians agents are believed to be hiding in the hills around Kladovo, the radio said without elaborating. There was no immediate confirmation of the incident by police.
